FuncDef:
The sip-server command configures the IP address or name of an SIP server.
The undo sip-server command cancels the configuration.
By default, no SIP server is configured.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IP address of an SIP server.
The value is in the dotted decimal format.

Specifies the name of an SIP server.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 characters.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
A maximum of two SIP servers can be configured in each address pool.
This command is not valid for the remote address pool.
Before configuring the IP address or name of an SIP server, ensure that the SIP server of the IP address or name exists and create a corresponding address pool by using the ip pool (system view) command in the system view.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
